title: The Little Lambs and the Very Special Mission
features: God asks a field full of playful little lambs to help Him with a very important mission. He tells them that the people of Earth have forgotten to be loving and kind to each other. God needs their help to remind the people of Earth how much He loves them. With the little lambs' help, the world becomes a better place.
The Little Lambs and the Very Special Mission offers children, families, and adults comfort, hope, and grief support after the death of a loved one.

From the Author

Author's note:  Like everyone else in our country, I was shocked and devastated by the massacre at Sandy Hook Elementary School, Newtown, CT, on December 14, 2012.   Twenty beautiful children and six heroic teachers were lost that day.  I prayed for them, all of them.  I prayed hard, and I know my prayers were added to those from around the world. During my prayers, I received a vision, a feeling.  The children became lambs; their teachers were angels.  I saw the little lambs scooped up into God's great, loving hands and escorted by the angels to Heaven.  Despite the horrors of the tragedy, this vision gave me some comfort.  It was like God was saying, "The kids are okay.  They are all okay.  They are with me.  They are mine and they are safe."  Then, this lovely little children's story tumbled into my heart and mind.  It was then that
The Little Lambs and the Very Special Mission
was born and began its journey.  This story is dedicated to the Sandy Hook children, their teachers, and all victims of violence.
From the Back Cover

Like everyone else in our country, I was shocked and devastated by the massacre at Sandy Hook Elementary School on December 14, 2012.   Twenty beautiful children and their six heroic teachers and staff were lost that day.  I prayed for them, all of them.  I prayed hard, and I know my prayers were added to those from around the world. During my prayers, I got a vision, a feeling.  The children became lambs; their teachers, angels.  I saw them scooped up into God's great, loving hands and carried off to Heaven. Despite the horrors of the tragedy, this vision gave me some comfort.  It was like God was saying, "The kids are okay.  They are all okay.  They are with me.  They are mine and they are safe.  "Then, this lovely little children's story tumbled into my heart and mind.  I was compelled to write and draw what I saw, what I felt.  My artistic talent is limited and I got stuck.  I couldn't finish the story because I couldn't do all the art work.  I prayed again.  "God, I believe you gave me this little story.  I believe you want me to finish it, but I need some help.  Please send someone to help me with the artwork." That is when Taylor Galaska, a Kennedy Catholic Middle School student, who was also deeply affected by the Sandy Hook tragedy, crossed my path.   A 14-year-old teenager came to my rescue.  Although I was a stranger, Taylor immediately said yes to my request for help with the art work. It was then that
The Little Lambs and the Very Special Mission
took on life and began its journey.
See, I will not forget you, I have carved you on the palm of my hand.  Isaiah 49:15
About the Author

Rhonda Paglia is a retired elementary school teacher from Pennsylvania.  She and her husband, Tony, have three children, five darling grandchildren, and a little dog named Bella.  As a teacher, Rhonda practiced emergency drills with her elementary students and worked every day to keep them safe while in her care.  She was devastated by the tragedy at Sandy Hook Elementary School on December 14, 2012, in Newtown, CT.  During her prayers for the children, families, and their community, she received an image of the 20 precious children as little lambs.  They were scooped up into God's hands and escorted to Heaven by the 6 "Angels in Charge," their heroic teachers. The inspiration of the children, their teachers, and their lives, gave birth to
The Little Lambs and the Very Special Mission
.   Rhonda's hope and prayers are that the messages of love and kindness in this little story will lift up the world and inspire us all to become "the higher angels of ourselves."
The Little Lambs and the Very Special Mission
is Rhonda's first story for distribution to the public. All proceeds from the sale of this book are donated to the "
Angels in Charge Scholarship

" in honor of the heroic teachers and staff of Sandy Hook Elementary, and all victims of violence.  This award goes to a graduating high school senior or seniors from Newtown, CT, who intend to pursue a career in elementary education.
